answers.answer: Yes, I also have two duplex kidneys and have not had much complication yet but my doctor advised me that I would be at a higher risk of kidney stones, cancer, diabetes but not till later in life as I'm only 22. Kidney and bladder infections is something all too common in our rare duplex family.Unfortunately...

question: I HAVE DOUBLE URETERS ON BOTH KIDNEYS.  I HAD A PYLOPLASTY ON MY RIGHT KIDNEY FROM THE AGE OF 10 YEARS OLD.  EVER SINCE THE PYLOPLASTY  I'VE HAD CHRONIC PAIN THERE AND I HAVE FORMED A TONNE OF KIDNEY STONES.  MY QUESTION IS THIS:  IF I WAS BORN WITH ONLY ONE URETER( AS MOST PEOPLE USUALLY ARE) WOULD I BE LESS LIKELY TO FORM KIDNEY STONES??
title: DUPLEX COLLECTING SYSTEM
